definition: to confer/to bestow/to grant
cowrie/shellfish/currency (archaic)
surname Bei
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
to grant/to bestow
bestowed by heaven
favor/to give charity to sb out of pity
to bestow/to give
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
to bless
to commit suicide on the orders of a sovereign (old)
to bestow a surname (of emperor conferring favor on ethnic group)
to award (a prize)/to confer on sb/to confer upon by authority
to be bestowed, conferred, or granted by the emperor
(derog.) this is all thanks to you!/well, thanks a lot!
Duanmu Ci (520 BC-446 BC), disciple of Confucius, also known as Zi Gong 子貢|子贡[Zi3 Gong4]
variant of 賜予|赐予[ci4 yu3]

sentences.english: Each day I live, the grace you give.
sentences.chinese: 每天的生活，祢都赐下恩典。

sentences.english: From the father comes honour; from the mother, comfort.
sentences.chinese: 荣誉由父赐，安慰由母与。

sentences.english: The King sent over a package of powder for dressing the wounds together with a cup of ginseng soup for easing pain.
sentences.chinese: 国王命人赐了一包棒疮药，又送了一盏定痛人参汤。

sentences.english: Congratulations to you both and may the years ahead bring you continued joy and contentment.
sentences.chinese: 向你俩祝贺，愿时间白叟赐赉你们长久的幸福和满意。

sentences.english: Hast thou given the horse strength?
sentences.chinese: 马的大力是你所赐的吗。

sentences.english: Christ would ascend to heaven, and pray the Father to send the Comforter, the Holy Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣升上高天，求天父上帝，赐下圣灵保惠师。

sentences.english: Lord God, send a spirit of revival and may it begin in our own hearts.
sentences.chinese: 主神，请赐复兴的灵，并愿它从我们心中开始。

sentences.english: For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven, and giveth life unto the world.
sentences.chinese: 因为神的粮，就是那从天上降下来赐生命给世界的。

sentences.english: We have sought him, and he has given us peace on every side.
sentences.chinese: 我们既寻求他，他就赐我们四境平安。

sentences.english: And the king said, What honour and dignity hath been done to Mordecai for this?
sentences.chinese: 王说，末底改行了这事，赐他什么尊荣爵位没有。

sentences.english: It allows me to quickly open the folders and windows I use frequently.
sentences.chinese: 拜它所赐我可以快速打开我的常用文件夹和窗口。

sentences.english: If you believe in preyer, prey that people will find the strength to change .
sentences.chinese: 相信祈祷的话，可祈祷求神赐人以改变的力量。

sentences.english: November is for thanksgiving, count God's bounteous graces.
sentences.chinese: 十一月是感恩的季节，细数神所赐的丰盛恩典。

sentences.english: Plead with the Lord for greater cooperation between nations.
sentences.chinese: 恳求主在国与国之间赐下更大的合作。

sentences.english: Nature, very oddly, when the horn of plenty is quite empty, always fills it with babies.
sentences.chinese: 说也奇怪，大自然不丰赐五谷时，却往往多降婴儿。

sentences.english: Whengrace is lost from life, come with a burst of song.
sentences.chinese: 当生命失去恩宠时，请赐我以欢歌。

definition: to bestow/to give
variant of 賜予|赐予[ci4 yu3]
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
to award (a prize)/to confer on sb/to confer upon by authority
to be bestowed, conferred, or granted by the emperor
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
special favor from a ruler/Emperor's generosity towards a favorite
variant of 敕[chi4]
imperial orders
variant of 敕[chi4]
approved by His (or Her) Majesty/permission graciously granted (from highly authoritative position)/to graciously permit/to condescend to allow
to issue an imperial edict
imperial order
to appoint sb to a post or confer a title on sb by imperial order
official ranking/titles and honors
favor/grace
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
